alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Kenedy Island; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 12:59AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Kenedy, southern Hidalgo, Cameron and Willacy Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1259 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of Kenedy County Wind Farms to near Port Mansfield Airport to near San Benito Veterans Memorial Academy to near Santa Ana National Wildlife Refuge. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Edinburg, Mission, Pharr, Harlingen, Weslaco, San Juan, San Benito, Alamo, Donna and Mercedes. This includes the following highways... US Highway 83 between mile markers 844 and 850. Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 1 and 51. Interstate Highway 69 C between mile markers 1 and 11. US Highway 77 between mile markers 756 and 762. US Highway 281 between mile markers 784 and 788, and between mile markers 798 and 838. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
